page.title: 08Farming near Exmoor
page.content: Agriculture predominates in this area.Most farms are relatively small family farms.Although about 90% of the land is owner occupied,some 10% is rented,mainly by new entrants into farming.All the full-time farms have livestock enterprises.There are about 2000 sheep,800 beef animals,330 dairy cows and followers.There is only one commercial laying poultry flock and one broiler chicken unit.There are a few dozen milking goats and a similar number of riding horses. It is significant that 5 of the 11 full-time farmers supplement their in- come with paying summer guests. Because much of the land is very steep or wet(old moors) harvesting of crops is impossible on much of this area,high rainfall(>50"), fairly high altitude(600-800')dictate the practice of grassland not arable farming.
